chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Adams Terwall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for consolidation of criminal charges

records.addlTxt: Juneau County Case No. 16 CF 40 signed by Assistant District Attorney Jessica Miller
Sauk County Case No. 16 CF 23 signed by Assistant District Attorney Linda Hoffman

1:44 P.M., Defendant Samuel Adams Terwall in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Burdon files consent to consolidate Juneau and Sauk County Cases, Court accepts consolidation, Amended Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 3 (Sauk County Case), Ct. 4 (Juneau County Case) and Ct. 5 (Juneau County Case) dismissed, read in, Court sentences defendant to : Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 4 years. concurrent, $518.00 costs, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Sex Offender Registry, no contact w/victims, M.V., J.W. and C.B., Ct. 2, Court withholds sentence, probation 4 years, 9 months jail w/Huber, Jail start date 12/2/16 at 7:00 P.M., may serve sentence in Sauk County Jail, 3 days sentence credit, $268.00 costs, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Sex Offender, no contact w/victims, M.V., J.W. and C.B., 2:22 P.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel Adams Terwall in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to be set for a status conference after court today. Atty. Covey to contact Br. 2 JA.
